metadata.title: Wednesday, 6th November, 2024
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Green Economy and Environment what measures the Government is taking against charcoal burning to mitigate the effects of climate change.
Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) when rehabilitation of Chipata-Lundazi-Chama-Matumbo road will commence;
(b) who the contractor for the project is;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) when the Government will operationalise the Chabbobboma Irrigation Scheme in Gwembe District;
(b) what the cause of the delay in operationalising the Scheme is; and
(c) what short and long term measures are being taken to mitigate the effects of drought in Southern Province and other parts of the country.
(a) how many special schools for autistic children there were, countrywide, as of March, 2024;
(b) what the total number of trained teachers specialised in teaching autistic children, countrywide, was as of the date at (a); and
(c) what measures are being taken to ensure that children living with autism attain full secondary education.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) what the rationale for the relocation of the Zambia Correctional Service Headquarters from Kabwe District to Lusaka District was;
(b) whether the decision to relocate the Headquarters was in conformity with the National Decentralisation Policy;
(c) if so, whether a survey was conducted in order to ascertain the adverse effects of relocating the Headquarters; and
(d) whether the Government has any plans to rescind its decision. 6. ORDER OF THE DAY Supply - Motion (5th November) - Resumption of Debate. ___________________________
